intro: Oligoceras, commonly known as the "little horn," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clustered umbels of white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Oligoceras species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for both ecological studies and horticultural use.
